definition: classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
see 腳踏兩隻船|脚踏两只船[jiao3 ta4 liang3 zhi1 chuan2]
to see what others fail to see (idiom)/to have exceptional insight
lit. a lonely body with only a shadow for company/to be all alone (idiom)
see 獨具隻眼|独具只眼[du2 ju4 zhi1 yan3]
lit. a chicken and a bottle of wine (idiom); fig. ready to make an offering to the deceased, or to entertain guests

pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

sentences.english: The cat under the table is Tama.
sentences.chinese: 桌子下面的那隻貓叫塔瑪。

sentences.english: But just 9 percent of those who use M.I.T. OpenCourseWare are educators.
sentences.chinese: 但是隻有9%使用麻省理工開放課程的網友是教育者。
他們全喫光了那隻火雞。

sentences.english: Hard find … a mossy leaf-tailed gecko is nearly impossible to spot on tree.
sentences.chinese: 這隻苔蘚滿身的扁葉尾壁虎趴在樹上，幾乎認不出來。

sentences.english: No one could account for the fact that one of the boxes was extremely heavy.
sentences.chinese: 此中有隻箱子特別重，可誰也弄不清是怎麼回事。

sentences.english: The little chicks had no more than whetted his appetite.
sentences.chinese: 那幾只小雞隻不過引起了他的食慾而已。

sentences.english: The dog barked and gave him a fright.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗的吠叫使他嚇了一跳。

sentences.english: A dog with the correct proportions and angulation can thereby achieve static balance.
sentences.chinese: 擁有的正確比例和角度，從而達到犬隻的靜態平衡。

sentences.english: The dealer sells each cat for about 50 yuan (US$7.31) to restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 這些貓販子以每隻貓50元人民幣的價格賣給餐館。

sentences.english: The old clock finally wore out.
sentences.chinese: 這隻舊鐘終於不能再用了。

sentences.english: And grows erect as that comes home.
sentences.chinese: 當那隻腳回到家，它又把腰桿直起。

sentences.english: Who should get the best ones?
sentences.chinese: 誰該得到最好的那隻長笛？

sentences.english: My line hadcaught on a small chip in the lip.
sentences.chinese: 我的繩子剛好掛住了這隻瓷盤邊上的一個小缺口。

sentences.english: The box that the fur came out of was on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 裝狐皮圍巾的那隻盒子放在牀上。

sentences.english: Yet, this addresses only one, the outer side of the skin .
sentences.chinese: 然而，這隻作用於一處，皮膚的外部。

sentences.english: Instead the neighborhood would best be described as hectic and smelly.
sentences.chinese: 這隻能概括爲忙忙碌碌和臭烘烘。

definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
